intro: Hieracium jurassicum subsp. hemiplecoides, commonly known as the Jurassic hawkweed, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique morphological features, including a particular arrangement of leaves and flower structures. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows or along riverbanks. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, this subspecies is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
